Outcome: Changes in intensity of pain (VAS) when tested through air blast stimuli - short term (0 to 24 hours)
Reasons for GRADE if not High: Downgraded 2 levels for inconsistency: marked heterogeneity is noted among the studies (I2 = 99%).

Outcome: Changes in intensity of pain (VAS) when tested through air blast stimuli - medium term (24 hours to 2 months)
Reasons for GRADE if not High:
Downgraded 1 level for risk of bias: blinding of outcome assessors was not performed or unclear in studies that contribute significantly to the participants' pool. Blinding of participants was not performed in 1 of the parallel studies.
Downgraded 2 levels for inconsistency: marked heterogeneity is noted among the studies (I2 = 98%).

Outcome: Changes in intensity of pain (VAS) when tested through tactile stimuli - short term (0 to 24 hours)
Reasons for GRADE if not High:
Downgraded 1 level for risk of bias: studies with significant contribution to data analysis were rated as at unclear and high risk of bias for randomization and blinding of outcome assessors.
Downgraded 1 level for inconsistency: marked heterogeneity with I2 = 92% and some studies crossing the threshold.

Outcome: Changes in intensity of pain (VAS) when tested through tactile stimuli - long term (more than 2 months)
